articles.content:
MOU and Agreement Signed between DPRK and Syria 
   Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) - A memorandum of understanding on cooperation in the fields of housing and other construction and an agreement on the promotion and protection of investment were signed between the  governments of the DPRK and Syria in Pyongyang on May 14.
 Present at the signing ceremony were members of the DPRK government economic delegation led by Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, and members of the Syrian government economic delegation led by Minister of Economy and Commerce Amer Hosni Lutfi and Syrian Charge d'Affaires A.I. in Pyongyang Muhammad Adib Al Hani.    
 The MOU and the agreement were inked by Rim Kyong Man and Amer Hosni Lutfi.

articles.content:
S. Korean Visiting Group Arrives Here
   Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) -- A south Korean visiting group headed by Director of the south Korean Development Center Hyon Jong Thaek arrived here on Monday to inspect the 9th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair.
 It was greeted at the airport by Vice-Chairman of the National Reconciliation Council Pak Kyong Chol.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Heads of Chinese Delegations
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Heads of Chinese Delegations
   Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by the heads of a delegation of the China Development Bank and a delegation of the China Council for the Promotion of International Trade and the Chamber of International Commerce on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gifts were handed to Vice-Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Ro Tu Chol on Monday by Governor of the bank Chen Won and Chairman of the council and the chamber Wan Jifei, who are leading the delegations.

Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation 
   Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by the Chinese delegation of martyr Mao Anying's family and his relatives, the head of the delegation, family members and relatives who came to the DPRK to visit the grave of Mao Anying, son of Chairman Mao Zedong, the great leader of the Chinese people, who fell in the Korean war.
 The gifts were handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Monday by head of the delegation Shao Hua, former Deputy Department Director of the Chinese Academy of Military Science, family members and relatives.
